stadium.name: The Hollow Mine
stadium.description: The playing field is the circular, wildflower-covered clearing at the base of the imposing, ivy-covered Watch Tower. The ground hums with a strange energy, and the home team makes their entrance from the newly-opened mine shaft that bores deep into the tower's foundation.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing how many dried beans they can fit in their nostril.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.

stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.

preGame: # üéôÔ∏è LIVE FROM THE HOLLOW MINE: TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL! üéôÔ∏è ‚öæÔ∏è Well hello there, sports fans! This is your favorite demon of the airwaves, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the wildflower-covered base of the Watch Tower! Can you feel that energy? The ground is literally humming, or maybe that's just the anticipation of seeing some skulls cracked for your Tuesday evening entertainment! We‚Äôve got a real peach of a matchup tonight as the Kerlauger Runeguard travel from their crumbling ruins to face our hosts, the Wyrmwood Stronghammers! üí• ‚öæÔ∏è Now look at these Stronghammers, folks! These boys and ghouls are emerging from a mine shaft like it's a grand opening of a fresh grave! I saw Ultun Barthelemy in the tunnel earlier, diligently braiding a teammate's nose hair‚Äînow that is the kind of focus that wins championships! And keep an eye on Calvinna Isador; she‚Äôs currently giving a speech so nonsensical it makes Sir Randy's tactical advice look like high philosophy! It‚Äôs absolute madness, and I love every second of it! üçñ ‚öæÔ∏è But don't count out the Kerlauger Runeguard! They might be associated with those stuffy White Ravens, but they play like they‚Äôve got something to prove! Eal Caundra is over there reciting the names of legends‚Äîboring!‚Äîbut Vivia Namara just spat in her own hand and slapped herself across the face! Now that‚Äôs a pre-game ritual I can get behind! It‚Äôs almost as good as the rituals we see with the Ebon Gate Corruptors, who truly know how to treat a Trollhead with respect! Unlike those Haven Lights, who probably wash their hands after every tackle! Let‚Äôs get to the carnage! ü¶¥
postGame: # üèüÔ∏è FINAL SCORE: STRONGHAMMERS SMASH THE RUNEGUARD! üèüÔ∏è ‚öæÔ∏è What a humdinger of a match we witnessed tonight, folks! It was a real seesaw of violence that would make even my old boss Orzalon crack a smile from his prison cell! The action started fast and furious in Center Field when Gurney Fadiman scooped up the head, but Ultun Barthelemy wasn't having any of that! Ultun came in with a tackle so crisp it sent Gurney straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! Ha-ha! That‚Äôs the kind of Tuesday night I live for! üí• ‚öæÔ∏è The Runeguard tried to fight back, and let me tell you, Lon Gabriell was a one-woman wrecking crew! She wasn't just blocking; she was hunting! She took Ultun Barthelemy right out of the game with a tackle that sounded like a dry branch snapping! Not content with just one scalp, she later leveled Calvinna Isador! If the rest of the Runeguard had half her fire, they wouldn‚Äôt be looking at a goose egg on the scoreboard right now! ü•ä ‚öæÔ∏è We saw a bit of high-flying desperation when Benjie Foulk tried to air it out, but Odelia Abbott was there to play spoiler! Odelia snatched that pass right out of the air like a hawk grabbing a field mouse! It was a beautiful interception, though I must say, the 'heroes' of the realm like Sir Tanos usually need a cursed sword to be that effective. Odelia just did it with grit and a whip in hand! ü¶Ö ‚öæÔ∏è By the time halftime rolled around, the ground was soaked with more than just that strange 'humming energy.' Both teams took a breather to let the regeneration kick in. It‚Äôs a miracle of Osterra, isn't it? One minute you‚Äôre a pile of broken bones, the next you‚Äôre back on the field ready for more! It‚Äôs certainly more efficient than waiting for Imra to mix up a dusty elixir! üß™ ‚öæÔ∏è The second half saw the Wyrmwood Stronghammers really turn up the heat. Cornela Piscatelli‚Äîwho, mind you, spent his pre-game braiding nose hairs‚Äîdecided to start braiding ribs instead! He absolutely leveled Reginauld Cordell, leaving him for the healers to sort out! It was a textbook hit, the kind we usually see from the Ebon Gate Corruptors on a Saturday night! üí• ‚öæÔ∏è Then came the breakthrough! Autumn Jodoin, after chugging enough raw eggs to make a dragon gag, found a seam in the defense! With the ball tucked tight, Autumn sprinted through the Away 2-Point zone and slammed that troll head right into the goal! Dunk! The crowd went wild, and the Stronghammers took a 1-0 lead! It was poetry in motion, if poetry involved heavy armor and sweat! üìù ‚öæÔ∏è The Runeguard tried to mount a comeback, with Gurney Fadiman returning to the field and immediately taking his frustrations out on Godart Urissa! Godart went down hard, but the Stronghammers are made of sterner stuff! They didn't let the injury slow them down for a second! They‚Äôre probably used to it, living so close to that merchant prince Trez Arrigo; you have to be tough to survive that much 'commerce'! üí∞ ‚öæÔ∏è Rebane Kendy, the man who loves a good earlobe tug, decided he wanted a piece of the glory too! While Lorilee Aldred was busy flattening Cornela Piscatelli in a fit of rage, Kendy found the opening! He danced through the defense and delivered a second dunk right into the basket! 2-0, Stronghammers! The Kerlauger defense looked like it was standing in dense fog even though the sun was still up! üå´Ô∏è ‚öæÔ∏è As the final whistle blew, the Kerlauger Runeguard were left scratching their heads and licking their wounds. Lorilee Aldred got one last tackle in on Cornela, but it was far too little, far too late! The Stronghammers defended their Hollow Mine with the kind of ferocity that would make a Bog Queen proud! üè∞ ‚öæÔ∏è So there you have it, folks! A 2-0 victory for the Wyrmwood Stronghammers! They played with heart, they played with steel, and most importantly, they played with a complete disregard for their opponents' well-being! Kerlauger is going back to their ruins with nothing but bruises and memories of a sound beating! üìâ ‚öæÔ∏è This is Nok the Corrupter signing off! Remember, life is short, the Everwar is long, and Trollball is the only thing that makes the regeneration worth it! Stay brutal, Osterra! And if you see Sir Artorias, tell him he still owes me a souvenir from the Fey realm! Goodnight, everyone! üéôÔ∏èüåë
